Others: The Cubs finished August with a 18-8 record, improving their chances of clinching a wild-card spot.
Cubs center fielder Pete Crow-Armstrong made a key play by catching a line drive and throwing out the runner at second base.
CJ Abrams was thrown out at second base after attempting to steal.
Manager Craig Counsell praised the pitching and defense of the team in their 5-3 win over the Nationals.
